meanings.definition: To remove or get rid of something
meanings.sent1: She was eliminating the weeds from her garden.
meanings.sent2: The cleaner was eliminating the stains from the carpet.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought it was eliminating the invisible enemy under the bed.
meanings.sent4: By eliminating distractions, he was able to focus better on his work.
meanings.sent5: The detective was eliminating suspects one by one to solve the case.

meanings.definition: To exclude or rule out something
meanings.sent1: They were eliminating certain options to narrow down the choices.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was eliminating incorrect answers from the test.
meanings.sent3: The magician was eliminating the possibility of any trickery.
meanings.sent4: By eliminating uncertainties, they were able to make a clear decision.
meanings.sent5: The process of elimination was key to eliminating the wrong answers.

meanings.definition: To defeat or surpass an opponent
meanings.sent1: The team was eliminating their rivals one by one.
meanings.sent2: The champion was eliminating all doubts about their skills.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was eliminating the competition for the best acorns.
meanings.sent4: By eliminating weaknesses, he became a formidable opponent.
meanings.sent5: His strategic moves were aimed at eliminating any chance of defeat.
